name: Moamen and k-subarrays
statement: Moamen has an array of $$$n$$$ distinct integers. He wants to sort that array in non-decreasing order by doing the following operations in order exactly once : Split the array into exactly $$$k$$$ non-empty subarrays such that each element belongs to exactly one subarray. Reorder these subarrays arbitrary. Merge the subarrays in their new order. A sequence $$$a$$$ is a subarray of a sequence $$$b$$$ if $$$a$$$ can be obtained from $$$b$$$ by deletion of several (possibly, zero or all) elements from the beginning and several (possibly, zero or all) elements from the end. Can you tell Moamen if there is a way to sort the array in non-decreasing order using the operations written above?
inputFormat: The first line contains a single integer $$$t$$$ ($$$1 \le t \le 10^3$$$) â€” the number of test cases. The description of the test cases follows. The first line of each test case contains two integers $$$n$$$ and $$$k$$$ ($$$1 \le k \le n \le 10^5$$$). The second line contains $$$n$$$ integers $$$a_1, a_2, \ldots, a_n$$$ ($$$0 \le |a_i| \le 10^9$$$). It is guaranteed that all numbers are distinct . It is guaranteed that the sum of $$$n$$$ over all test cases does not exceed $$$3\cdot10^5$$$.
outputFormat: For each test case, you should output a single string. If Moamen can sort the array in non-decreasing order, output " YES " (without quotes). Otherwise, output " NO " (without quotes). You can print each letter of " YES " and " NO " in any case (upper or lower).
